verse.name: v1
verse.lines: There was a woman, oh but she was a widow Fair as the flowers in the valley With a daughter as fair as a fray sunny meadow The red and the green and the yellow

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: No harp, no lute, nor pipe nor flute nor cymbal As sweet grows the treble violin

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: This maiden so fair and the flower so rare Together they grew in the valley Oh, then came this knight all dressed in red Fair as the flowers in the valley "Thou art my bride", I'll say, "thou as thee said" The red and the green and the yellow

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: "Oh no" said she "Oh thou'st never win me" As fair as the flowers in the valley Oh, then came this knight all dressed in green Fair as the flowers in the valley "Thou must be, I see thou as my queen" The red and the green and the yellow

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: "Oh no" said she "Oh thou'st never win me" As fair as the flowers in the valley Oh, then came this knight all dressed in yellow Fair as the flowers in the valley "Thou art my love and my bride" said he The red and the green and the yellow

verse.name: c2
verse.lines: "I'll come" said she "I'll go with thee" Farewell to the flowers in the valley
